fs.polyglot.undo
Class UndoablePolyglotStringEdit

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
      fs.polyglot.undo.UndoablePolyglotStringEdit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
public class UndoablePolyglotStringEdit
extends javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit

This class represents a change in a polyglot string, i.e. an addition, a removal or a change of its group or name (Changes to variants are represented by UndoableVariantEdit). Usually an instance of this class is not created directly but via an UndoableEditFactory instance.

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

UndoablePolyglotStringEdit

public UndoablePolyglotStringEdit(PolyglotString oldValue,
                                  PolyglotString newValue,
                                  PolyglotTableModel table,
                                  PolyglotStringLoader loader,
                                  java.lang.String languageID)
Creates an edit representing a change to a polyglot string

Parameters:
oldValue - The old value. If null, this is considered a removal
newValue - The new value. If null, this is considered an addition. If both are null, this operation has no effect and if both are non-null, this operation is either a group change (if both id's are equal) or a renaming (if they are not)
table - The table in which to perform the changes. If this is null, the edit has no effect.
loader - The string loader for loading representation names. If null, the default loader is used
languageID - The language id for the representation names. If null, the global language id is used.
Method Detail

canRedo

public boolean canRedo()
Specified by:
canRedo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canRedo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following is true:
- Both values or the table are null
- This represents a removal and the old string id exists in the table
- This represents an addition and the new string id does not exist in the table
- This represents a group change or rename and the id of oldValue exists in the table

canUndo

public boolean canUndo()
Specified by:
canUndo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canUndo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following is true:
- Both values or the table are null
- This represents a removal and the old string id doesn't exist in the table
- This represents an addition and the new string id exists in the table
- This represents a group change or rename and the id of oldvalue exists in the table.

performStringEdit

public static void performStringEdit(PolyglotTableModel table,
                                     PolyglotString oldval,
                                     PolyglotString newval,
                                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> variantstoadd)
                              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
This method tries to perform the change on the specified table as indicated by the old and new values.

Parameters:
variantstoadd - - If this represents an addition, these variants are all added to the new string. If this represents any other change, this parameter is ignored.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - - If the operation cannot be performed. See the documentation of the canUndo() and canRedo() methods for a detailed explanation.
